post.description:
This endpoint gives the estimated transit times for a particular shipment.
Note: FedEx APIs do not support Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) mechanism.

parameters.name: x-customer-transaction-id
parameters.description: This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply. It also helps you to track the transaction with APIF.

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: This is used to indicate the media type of the resource. The media type is a string sent along with the file indicating format of the file.

parameters.name: x-locale
parameters.description: This indicates the combination of language code and country code. Click here to see Locales

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: This indicates the authorization token for the input request.

example.error_detail: The resource you requested is no longer available. Please modify your request and try again.

errors.message: We encountered an unexpected error and are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.

x-code-samples.source:
<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('https://apis-sandbox.fedex.com/availability/v1/transittimes');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_POST);

$request->setHeaders(array(
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer ',
  'X-locale' => 'en_US',
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
));

$request->setBody(input); // 'input' refers to JSON Payload

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

import requests

url = "https://apis-sandbox.fedex.com/availability/v1/transittimes"

payload = input # 'input' refers to JSON Payload
headers = {
    'Content-Type': "application/json",
    'X-locale': "en_US",
    'Authorization': "Bearer "
    }

response = requests.post(url, data=payload, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

post.description:
Use this endpoint to return a list of all FedEx Express or FedEx Ground services and packaging type combinations that are available between the input origin and destination and subpackaging information.
Note: FedEx APIs do not support Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) mechanism.

errors.message: Customs Value currency type must be the same for all packages.
Access token expired. Please modify your request and try again.
We could not authorize your credentials. Please check your permissions and try again
The resource you requested is no longer available. Please modify your request and try again.
We encountered an unexpected error and are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.
The service is currently unavailable and we are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.

parameters.name: x-locale
parameters.description: This indicates the combination of language code and country code. Click here to see Locales

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: This indicates the authorization token for the input request.

post.description:
Use this endpoint to request list of all available FedEx services, shipment special, service options along with delivery signature options and return shipment types that are available between an origin and destination. You can filter the results using FedEx carrier code(s) and/or service type(s) for specific services.
Note: FedEx APIs do not support Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) mechanism.

errors.message: The packaging is required and cannot be null or empty.
Access token expired. Please modify your request and try again.
We could not authorize your credentials. Please check your permissions and try again
The resource you requested is no longer available. Please modify your request and try again.
We encountered an unexpected error and are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.
The service is currently unavailable and we are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.

parameters.description: This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: This is used to indicate the media type of the resource. The media type is a string sent along with the file indicating format of the file.

parameters.name: x-locale
parameters.description: This indicates the combination of language code and country code. Click here to see Locales

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: This indicates the authorization token for the input request.

x-code-samples.source:
<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('https://apis-sandbox.fedex.com/availability/v1/specialserviceoptions');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_POST);

$request->setHeaders(array(
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer ',
  'X-locale' => 'en_US',
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
));

$request->setBody(input); // 'input' refers to JSON Payload

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

import requests

url = "https://apis-sandbox.fedex.com/availability/v1/specialserviceoptions"

payload = input # 'input' refers to JSON Payload
headers = {
    'Content-Type': "application/json",
    'X-locale': "en_US",
    'Authorization': "Bearer "
    }

response = requests.post(url, data=payload, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

output.description: This is the output response details for the services and transit time request.

TransitTimeOutputVO.description: Gives the transit time details of the shipment based on the request provided.

alerts.description: These are alert details received with the response.

transitTimes.description: These are services and transit times details received in the response.

encoded.description: This field specifies the encoded flag.

TransitTimeOutput.description: This is the output response details for the services and transit time request.

transitTimeDetails.description: Specifies the details regarding transit times.

TransitTime.description: Specifies the commit time for a FedEx Ground shipment.

serviceType.description: Type of the service is returned.

customerMessages.description: These are messages returned in the response.

TransitTimeDetail.description: These are the transit time associated with the available shipment services.

message.description:
Specifies the message received by the customer.
Example: Rate does not include duties & taxes, clearance entry fees or other import fees. The payor of duties/taxes/fees will be responsible for any applicable Clearance Entry Fees.
message.example: Rate does not include dities & taxes, clearance entry fees or other import fees.  The payor of duties/taxes/fees will be responsible for any applicable Clearance Entry Fees

CustomerMessage.description: Messages concerning the ability to provide an accurate delivery commitment on an International commit quote.  These could be messages providing information about why a commitment could not be returned or a successful message such as REQUEST_COMPLETED

units.description: Indicates the unit of measure for the distance value.

Distance.description: This is a total distance between origin and destination city centers for freight shipments.

brokerCommitTimestamp.description:
The delivery commitment date/time the shipment will arrive at the border.
format [YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS:00Z]

cutOffTime.description:
Identifies the latest allowed ready time for the pickup option. The time is local to the pickup postal code. It includes a TZD (time zone designator) for FedEx Freight requests.
Format: HH:MM:SS
Example: 18:30:00

commodityName.description: The Commodity applicable to this commitment.

commitMessageDetails.description: This is a message concerning the ability to provide an accurate delivery commitment on an International commit quote. These could be messages providing information about why a commitment could not be returned or a successful message such as 'REQUEST COMPLETED'

serviceArea.description: This is the FedEx recognized service area code.

countryCode.description:
This represents the FedEx-system recognized country code.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

locationId.description: This is the unique FedEx location identifier.

airportId.description: This is a FedEx unique identifier for the Airport.

postalCode.description: This represents the FedEx-system recognized postal code.

stateOrProvinceCode.description: This represents the FedEx-system recognized state or province code.

locationNumber.description: The op-co specific numeric identifier for a FedEx location.

CleansedAddressandLocationDetail.description: This is the internal FedEx-system recognized address and location details.

value.description: Identifies the error option to be applied.

key.description: Indicates the value associated with the key.

Parameter.description: List of parameters which indicates the properties of the alert message.

carrierCodes.description:
Specify the four letter code of a FedEx operating company that meets your requirements
Examples of FedEx Operating Companies are:
  • FDXE - FedEx Express
  • FDXG - FedEx Ground
  • FXSP - FedEx SmartPost
  • FXCC - FedEx Custom Critical.

Full_Schema_TransitTime.description: TransitTimeInputVO describes the details needed in order to get the transit times for a particular shipment.

recipients.description: Provide recipients physical location/address details to where the shipment delivered.

serviceType.description:
Provide FedEx service type for the shipment. The results will be filtered by the serviceType value indicated. If no serviceType is indicated then all the applicable services and corresponding transit times will be returned.
Example: STANDARD_OVERNIGHT
Click here to see Service Types

shipDatestamp.description:
This is the Shipment date. Required for future ship date rates.Default is current date if not indicated or date is in the past.
Required Format is YYYY-MM-DD
example : 2019-09-01

pickupType.description:
Indicate the pickup type method by which the shipment to be tendered to FedEx.
Note: The value of this element does not specify dispatching the courier for package pickup.
Click here for more information on Pickup Types.
Note:For services like FedEx International Connect Plus(FICP) & Regional Economy(RE)/Regional Economy Freight(REF) pickupType is mandatory.

requestedPackageLineItems.description:
One or more package-attribute descriptions, each of which describes an individual package, a group of identical packages, or (for the total-piece-total-weight case) common characteristics of all packages in the shipment.
At least one array instance containing the weight for at least one package is required for EXPRESS and GROUND shipments. Not used for FREIGHT.
Single piece requests will have one RequestedPackageLineItem.
Multiple piece requests will have multiple RequestedPackageLineItems.
Maximum occurrences is 99.

TransitTimeRequestedShipment.description: Provide shipment data details for which a transit time is desired.

city.description:
The name of city, town, etc.
Example: Beverly Hills

stateOrProvinceCode.description:
Identifying abbreviation for US state, canada Province. Format and presence of this field will vary, depending on the country. State code is required for US, CA, PR and not required for other countries. Conditional. Not used for Ground/SmartPost. Max length is 2.
Example: TN

postalCode.description:
Identification of a region for mail/package delivery. Format and presence of this field will vary, depending on the country. Optional for non postal-aware countries. Maximum length is 10.
Example: 38127

countryCode.description:
The two-letter code used to identify a country. Max length is two.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

residential.description:
Indicates whether this address is residential (as opposed to commercial).
Example: false

TransitTimeShipper.description: Descriptive data on physical location. May be used as an actual physical address (place where one could go), or as a container of address parts, which should be handled as a unit (such as a city-state-ZIP combination within the US). Country code is required. Postal code is required for postal aware countries.

TransitTimeRecipient.description: Indicate the descriptive data for the recipient location to which the shipment is to be received.

paymentType.description:
Applicable for Express and Ground rates.
Indicates who and how the shipment will be paid for.

TransitTimeShippingChargesPayment.description:
Details about who and how the shipment will be paid for. 'payor' is optional when 'paymentType' provided is SENDER.
Note: For services like FedEx International Connect Plus(FICP) & Regional Economy(RE)/Regional Economy Freight(REF) account number is mandatory to be provided under shippingChargesPayment.

description.description:
Indicate the description of the dutiable packages.
Maximum Length is 450.
Example: DOCUMENTS
Click here to see Vague commodity descriptions

quantity.description:
Specify the total number of units (using quantityUnits as the unit of measure) of this commodity present in the shipment. This element is used to estimate duties and taxes.
Example: 1

numberOfPieces.description:
Specifies the number of pieces for this commodity.
Example: 10

countryOfManufacture.description:
This is a manufacturing country. Maximum field Length is 4.
Example: IN

quantityUnits.description:
Indicate unit quantity used to estimate duties and taxes.
Example: PCS

harmonizedCode.description:
This is to specify the Harmonized Tariff System (HTS) code to meet U.S. and foreign governments' customs requirements. These are mainly used to estimate the duties and taxes.
Example: A six digit code for Almonds fresh or dried is 080211. The HTS code for pistachios in shell is 080251. The HTS code for fish is HS203.
To research the classification for your commodity, use the FedEx Global Trade Manager online at fedex.com/gtm. You can find the commodities and its respective codes by logging into FedEx and selecting harmonized code option. You will find country-specific information to determine whether your commodity is considered to be a document or non-document for your destination.
For additional information about harmonized code, refer to harmonized code.

partNumber.description: Specify the part number if any. Example: P1

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

CmdcResponseVO.description: This is a wrapper class for outputVO

packageOptions.description:
The available packaging options for the shipment. This also includes the applicable rate types, the weight limit, or any other information related to the shipment.
Valid values for the weight limit are:
-maxMetricWeightAllowed
-maxWeightAllowed
-oneRateMaxWeightAllowed
-oneRateMaxMetricWeightAllowed

oneRate.description: Indicates if OneRate is applicable to the packaging. Returns the response as True if OneRate is applicable. Otherwise the response is False.

advancedRegulatoryPackages.description: The information for advanced regulatory packages.

items.description: Response model which holds information about advancedRegulatoryPackages such as Key, DisplayText

serviceOptions.description: A list of key and value pairs representing the available service and packaging options.

alerts.description: The cxs alert type, alert code, and alert message that is received when package and service options are requested.

PackageAndServiceOptionsOutputVO.description: This is the output response details of Service and Packaging Option request.

serviceType.description:
Service Type represents some services like FEDEX_GROUND,INTERNATIONAL_PRIORITY, etc..,
Example: INTERNATIONAL_PRIORITY
Click here to see Service Types

oneRateMaxWeightAllowed.description: Maximum Weight allowed for the Packaging type to send with One Fixed Rate

maxWeightAllowed.description: Maximum Weight allowed for the Packaging type

rateTypes.description: A set of possible rate types allowed for each Package type

packagingInfoList.description: An array of possible packaging types, a packaging description and applicable dimensions for each Package type.

maxMetricWeightAllowed.description: Maximum Metric Weight allowed for the Packaging type

oneRateMaxMetricWeightAllowed.description: Maximum Metric Weight allowed for the Packaging type with One Fixed Rate

maxDeclaredValue.description: This is the maximum declared value.

PackageTypeDetail.description: Holds the details of allowed Packaging Types for the origin and destination provided.

batteryMaterialType.description: Describes the material composition of the battery or cell.

dimension.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

description.description: The description of the SubPackage Type

SubPackageInfo.description: Holds the Sub Packaging details for the PackageType

amount.description:
This is the amount. Max length 18 including decimal.
Example: 12.45

currency.description:
This is the currency code for the amount.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency Codes

Money.description: Optional, but if indicated 'amount' and 'currency' must be provided.

requestedShipment.description: The descriptive data for the requested shipment.

carrierCodes.description:
"Specify the four letter code of a FedEx operating company that meets your requirements
Examples of FedEx Operating Companies are:
  • FDXE - FedEx Express
  • FDXG - FedEx Ground
  • FXSP - FedEx SmartPost
  • FXCC - FedEx Custom Critical.
"

accountNumber.description: This is a Payor account number associated with the shipment. Account number is required, for SmartPost shipments (i.e. Carrier code: FXSP)

systemOfMeasureType.description: This is system measurement type, such as Imperial or Metric.

Full_Schema_Package_And_Service_Options.description: These are the input elements for requesting package and service options.

deliveryInstructions.title: @Ignore4TPP
deliveryInstructions.description: Optional. Provides delivery instructions.  MaxLength is 90.

productInfo.title: @Ignore4TPP
productInfo.description: optional information aboutsender/recipient including Address, Contact, Account, TIN, DeliveryInstructions, Piece, ReferenceInfo, ProductInfo.

Party_Shipper.description: The shipper details, such as postal code, state or province code, and country code of the shipper.

streetLines.description:
This is a combination of number, street name, etc.
Note: At least one line is required and streetlines more than 3 will be ignored. Empty lines should not be included.
Example: [\"10 FedEx Parkway"\, \"Suite 302"\]

city.description:
This is a placeholder for City Name.
Example: Beverly Hills

stateOrProvinceCode.description:
This is a placeholder for State or Province code.
Example: CA
Click here to see State/Province Code

postalCode.description:
This is the Postal code. This is Optional for non postal-aware countries. Max length is 10.
Example: 65247
Click here to see Postal aware countries

countryCode.description:
This is a Two-letter country code.Max length is two.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

residential.description: Indicate whether this address is Residential as opposed to Commercial.

Address.description: This is detailed information on physical location. May be used as an actual physical address (place to which one could go), or as a container of address parts which should be handled as a unit (such as a city-state-ZIP combination within the US). Country code is required. Postal code is required for postal aware countries.

regulatoryReferenceNumber.description: Regulatory Reference Number for the shipment

yourReference.description: a customizable reference field for the shipment

purchaseOrderNumber.description: Purchase Order Number reference for the shipment

departmentNumber.description: Department Number reference for the shipment

invoiceNumber.description: Invoice Number reference for the shipment

referenceValue.description: Reference Value attached to the shipment

ReferenceInfo.description: Customers configurable reference Information for the shipment

customsValueAndWeightSpecifiedAsUnit.description: The total value declared to the Bureau of Customs and Border Protection for all packages in the shipment along with the weight details.

quantity.description: Quantity of the product in the package/shipment.

customsValue.description: Customs value of the product in the package/shipment.

weightUnitOfMeasureCode.description: Weight measurement unit code of the product in the package/shipment.

description.description: Description of the product in the package/shipment.

sedRequired.description: Indicates if shippers export declaration is required or not.

productType.description: Indicates the package/shipment contains documents or non-document commodities.

unitOfMeasureCode.description:
Specifies if shippers export declaration is required.
Valid values: True, False.

countryOfManufactureCode.description: Specify the country code of the product manufacturer.

ProductInfo.description: Information about the contents of the shipment.

Party.description: optional information about sender/recipient including Address, Contact, Account number.

physicalPackaging.description:
Specify the packaging used.
Example: FEDEX_PAK
Click here to see Package Types

groupPackageCount.description:
Indicate the grouped package count. These are number of identical package(s) each with one or more commodities.
Example: 2

itemDescriptionForClearance.description: Describe the content of the package for customs clearance purposes. This applies to intra-UAE, intra-Columbia and intra-Brazil shipments.

customerReferences.description: These are additional customer reference data for commercial invoice.

customerReferenceType.description:
This is a customer reference type. Note: Use type as RMA_ASSOCIATION and value as the RMA Number to associate Ground Call Tag shipments to the outbound shipment.
For more information, click here for Cutsomer References

value.description:
This is a customer reference type value.
Example: 3686

itemNumber.description:
This is a package item number.
Example: 45673289

receivedQuantity.description:
This is the package item quantity.
Example: 2

description.description: This is the description of the package item.

partNumber.description:
This is the part Number
Example: 123

signatureOptionType.description:
Indicate the Signature Type.
Valid Values:
  • ADULT - Adult signature required, at recipient address.
  • DIRECT - Signature required, at recipient address.
  • INDIRECT - Signature required, alternate address is accepted.(This option is available for residential deliveries only)
  • NO_SIGNATURE_REQUIRED - Signature is not required.
  • SERVICE_DEFAULT - Signature handled as per current Service Guide.

pieceCountVerificationBoxCount.description: Provide the pieceCount or VerificationBoxCount for batteries or cells that are contained within this specific package.

specialServiceTypes.description:
Special services requested for the shipment.
Example:
  • RETURN_SHIPMENT
  • BROKER_SELECT_OPTION
  • CALL_BEFORE_DELIVERY
  • COD
  • CUSTOM_DELIVERY_WINDOW
Click here to see Shipment level Special Service Types

standaloneBatteryDetails.description: Provide details about the batteries or cells that are contained within this specific package.

PackageSpecialServicesRequested.description: These are special services that are available at the package level for some or all service types.

signatureReleaseNumber.description:
This is the release number. Required if signature option is NO_SIGNATURE_REQUIRED.
Example: 23456

SignatureOptionDetail.description: These Signature option details.Required  if SignatureOptions is indicated.

alcoholRecipientType.description:
Specify the Alcohol Recipient Type of the shipment.
Example:
  • LICENSEE- FedEx approved alchol shipper having appropriate licenses.
  • CONSUMER- Individual consumer to whom the alchol is shipped.

shipperAgreementType.description: Specify the type of entity, the shipper for alcohol shipment is registered such as fulfillment house, retailer or a winery.

AlcoholDetail.description: These are details for the package containing alcohol. This is required for alcohol special service. The alcoholRecipientType is required.

accessibility.description:
Specify the Dangerous Goods Accessibility Type. Valid Values:
  • INACCESSIBLE - It does not have to be accessible on the aircraft.
  • ACCESSIBLE - It must be fully accessible on the aircraft, and is more strictly controlled.

options.description: Indicate the kind of content being reported.

DangerousGoodsDetail.description: Use this object to provide Dangerous Goods Detail in the shipment.

batteryPackingType.description: Describe the packing arrangement of the battery or cell with respect to other items within the same package.

batteryRegulatoryType.description: This is a regulation specific classification for the battery or the cell.

batteryMaterialType.description: Indicate the material composition of the battery or cell.

BatteryDetail.description: Provide details about the batteries or cells that are contained within this specific package.

codCollectionType.description: Identifies the type of funds FedEx should collect upon shipment delivery.

alternateBilling.description:
Optional : Designates a bill-to address
Example: true

lineItem.description:
Required

Class/weight pairs and associated details for a Freight shipment

role.description:
Required
Indicates the role of the party submitting the transaction
Example: SHIPPER

clientDiscountPercent.description:
Conditional
This is only used for anonymous rate requests
Example: 10.5

aliasID.description:
Conditional.
This is bill to alias identifier.

totalHandlingUnits.description:
Optional

Total number of individual handling units in the entire shipment (for unit pricing). May not be negative

FreightShipmentDetail.description:
Conditional

Details specific to a FedEx Freight LTL shipment (i.e. FedEx Priority and Economy Freight). If freight shipment detail is applicable, then the following fields are required. 'aliasID', 'clientDiscountPercent', 'fedExFreightAccountNumber', 'fedExFreightBillingContactAndAddress', 'lineItem', and 'role'.

pieces.description:
Optional
Total number of pieces
Example: 1

handlingUnits.description:
Optional
Number of individual handling units to which this line applies. (NOTE - Total of line-item-level handling units may not balance to shipment-level total handling units)
Example: 1

freightClass.description: Specify the freight class based on the item to be shipped and its weight measured per unit volume(Example: Kilograms per Cubic Meter) the shipment is categorized accordingly.Click here to use Freight class calculator

description.description:
Customer-provided description of this line item
Example: Description

weight.description: Total weight of items for this line item

packaging.description:
Packaging type for this line item
Example: SELFPACKAGE

classProvidedByCustomer.description:
defaults to false. FEDEX INTERNAL USE ONLY for FedEx system that estimate freight class from customer-provided dimensions and weight
Example: true

hazardousMaterials.description:
Indicates the kind of hazardous material content in this line item
Example: HAZARDOUS_MATERIALS

dimensions.description: Individual line item dimensions. Conditionally required. Need volume for intra mexico rates.

FreightShipmentLineItem.description: Description of an individual commodity or class of content in a shipment.

ContactAndAddress.description: Specifies the contact and address details of a location.

ContactAncillaryDetail.description: Indicate additional contact details such as email and phone information.

emailNotificationFormatType.description: These are email notification format type.

permissions.description: This is to specify the phone permission.

usage.description: Specify if the phone usage is Primary or Secondary.

areaCode.description: Indicate the Area Code for the phone number.

extension.description: Indicate the extension for the phone number.

countryCode.description:
The two-letter code used to identify a country.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

personalIdentificationNumber.description: Indicate the Personal Identification Number associated with the phone number.

localNumber.description: Indicate the local phone number for contacting in the event of an emergency.

PhoneNumber.description: A phone number for a party. Numeric only

division.description: This is division within a company.

department.description: This is department within a company

storeId.description: This is Store identifier within a company.

CompanyName.description: Use this to provide Company details.

locationInCity.description:
This is the Subdivision or community within a city for the given address.
Forester subdivision

suite.description: This is the suite information for the given address.

addressVerificationOverrideReason.description:
Specifies the reason to override address verification.
Valid values: CUSTOMER_PREFERENCE, CUSTOMER_PROVIDED_PROOF, MANUAL_VALIDATION

locationInProperty.description:
This is location in a campus, such as exterior building annex A.
Example: south west of main office entrance.

addtionalDescriptions.description:
Specifies any additional information about the given address.
Example: north door

department.description:
This is the department for the given address.
Example: Claims department

roomFloor.description:
This is to specify the room or floor information for the given address.
Example: 5th floor

crossStreet.description:
This is the cross street information for the given address.
Example: Union and Main

building.description:
This is the building information for the given address.
Example: Building 300

apartment.description:
This is the apartment information for the given address.
Example: Apartment 1503

room.description:
This is room specific information for the given address.
Example: Room B-23

AddressAncillaryDetail.description: specifies additional address details for the physical location

example.locationInProperty: south west of main office entrance

coverageType.description:
Optional
 This is the liability coverage type.

LiabilityCoverageDetail.description: This is used specify the line item level liability coverage.

specialServiceTypes.description:
Optional
The types of all special services requested for the enclosing shipment.
Example: FEDEX_EXPRESS
Click here to see Special Service Types

ShipmentSpecialServicesRequested.description: The types of all optional special services requested for the shipment

InternationalControlledExportDetail.description:
Use this object to specify International Controlled Export shipment Details.
Example: WAREHOUSE_WITHDRAWAL.

returnType.description: This is the return Type. Required to be set to PRINT_RETURN_LABEL for printed return label shipments. For email return label shipments returnType must be set to PENDING and pendingShipmentDetail must be set to EMAIL.

homedeliveryPremiumType.description: This is Home Delivery Premium Type. It allows to specify additional premium service options for the home delivery shipment. Can specify Evening delivery or a Date certain, or can specify appointment for the delivery.

HomeDeliveryPremiumDetail.description: These are Special service elements for FedEx Ground Home Delivery shipments. If selected, element homedeliveryPremiumType is mandatory.

merchantPhoneNumber.description:
This is the merchant phone number. Is Required for Email Return Labels.
Example: 19012635656

allowedSpecialService.description:
Indicate the allowed (merchant-authorized) special services which may be selected when the subsequent shipment is created.
Only services represented in EmailLabelAllowedSpecialServiceType will be controlled by this list.
Example :[SATURDAY_DELIVERY]

ReturnEmailDetail.description: These are Email details for the return shipment.

SaturdayDeliveryDetail.description: These are service elements for Saturday Delivery special service.

ParsedContactAndAddress.description: These are contact and address details for this special service.

locationId.description:
This is an alphanumeric identifier used for Location/Facility Identification.

Example: YBZA

Note:
  • For HAL Shipment, Location ID is REQUIRED to ensure packages are delivered to the right location.
  • Use endpoint [Find Location] in [Location Search API], to find the correct location ID for your shipment.

locationType.description:
Type of facility at which package/shipment is to be held.
Example: FEDEX_ONSITE

HoldAtLocationDetail.description:
Use this object to specify required information of a shipment to be held at FedEx destination location.

Note: This object HoldAtLocationDetail is REQUIRED, when HOLD_AT_LOCATION is chosen in the specialServiceTypes.

description.description: Specifies the number of days the package/shipment is to be in transit.

minimumTransitTime.description: This is a code indicating the number of transit days available.

CommitDetail_transitDays.description: The number of days the package/shipment is to be in transit. Applies to Ground and LTL Freight; indicates minimum transit time for SmartPost.

dayOfWeek.description:
This is a day of week in a shorter day format
Example: MON, TUE

time.description:
This is time in a day.
Format: [HH:MM:SS]
example: 09:30:00

day.description:
This is the day in format [MM-DD-YYYY]
example: Apr-13-2021

LocationDetail_geoPositionalCoordinates.description: the ISO6709GeographicCoordinates for a specific geographic location

TransitTimeRequestedShipment_shipper.description: The descriptive data on the physical location of shipment origin.

amount.description: Indicates the details of the charges are to be added to the COD collect amount.

currency.description:
Three-character ISO currency code.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency Codes

TransitTimeRequestedShipment_shipmentSpe.description: Amount to be charged for COD collection

codCollectionType.description: Indicate the type of funds FedEx should collect upon shipment delivery.

TransitTimeRequestedShipment_shipmentSpe.description: Use this object to specify Collect On Delivery (COD) shipment details.

type.description:
Indicate International Controlled Export Type.
Example: WAREHOUSE_WITHDRAWAL

TransitTimeRequestedShipment_shipmentSpe.description: Use this object to specify International Controlled Export shipment Details.

homedeliveryPremiumType.description: This is Home Delivery Premium Type. It allows to specify additional premium service options for the home delivery shipment. Can specify Evening delivery or a Date certain, or can specify appointment for the delivery.

TransitTimeRequestedShipment_shipmentSpe.description: These are Special service elements for FedEx Ground Home Delivery shipments. If selected, element homedeliveryPremiumType is mandatory.

personName.description:
Specify contact name.
Note: Recommended Length is 70. There's no specific validation for the length.
Example: John Taylor

emailAddress.description:
Specify contact email address. Maximum length is 80.
Example: sample@company.com

phoneNumber.description:
Specify contact phone number. Maximum length is 15.
Example: 1234567890

phoneExtension.description:
Specify contact phone extension. Maximum length is 6.
Example: 1234

faxNumber.description:
Specify contact fax number. Maximum length is 15.
Example: 1234567890

companyName.description: Specify contact company name. Maximum length is 35.

TransitTimeRequestedShipment_shipmentSpe.description: Specify the Hold at location contact details.
Specify the contact and address details of a location.

locationId.description:
This is an alphanumeric identifier used for Location/Facility Identification.

Example: YBZA

Note:
  • For HAL Shipment, Location ID is REQUIRED to ensure packages are delivered to the right location.
  • Use endpoint [Find Location] in [Location Search API], to find the correct location ID for your shipment.

locationType.description:
Specify the Hold at location type.
Example: FEDEX_ONSITE

TransitTimeRequestedShipment_shipmentSpe.description:
Use this object to specify required information of a shipment to be held at FedEx destination location.

Note: This object HoldAtLocationDetail is REQUIRED, when HOLD_AT_LOCATION is chosen in the specialServiceTypes.

units.description: Specify the unit of measurement used to  weigh the package. For Dry Ice the unit of measure is KG.

value.description:
Specify the value of the weight of the package.
Example: 68.25

packageCount.description:
Specify dry ice shipment package count.
Example: 12

TransitTimeRequestedShipment_shipmentSpe.description: Use this object to indicate package count with weight for this shipment containing dry ice. Dry ice is supported in both shipment level and package level services.

specialServiceTypes.description:
Indicate special services for which the rate data is being requested. Special Services are available at the shipment level for some or all service types.
Example: BROKER_SELECT_OPTION
Click here to see Shipment level Special Service Types

TransitTimeRequestedShipment_shipmentSpe.description:
Indicate special services for which the rate data is being requested. Special Services are available at the shipment level for some or all service types.
Example: [BROKER_SELECT_OPTION]

TransitTimeRequestedShipment_customsClea.description: This is Customs clearance data associated with the shipment. This is used for both international and intra-country shipping and rating. Customs commodity data is required for international and intra-country rating.

city.description:
The name of city, town, etc.
Example: Collierville

stateOrProvinceCode.description:
Identifying abbreviation for US state, canada Province. Format and presence of this field will vary, depending on the country. State code is required for US, CA, PR and not required for other countries. Conditional. Not used for Ground/SmartPost. Max length is 2.
Example: TN

postalCode.description:
Identification of a region for mail/package delivery. Format and presence of this field will vary, depending on the country.Optional for non postal-aware countries. Max length is 10.
Example: 38127

countryCode.description:
The two-letter code used to identify a country. Max length is two.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

residential.description:
Indicates whether the address is residential (as opposed to commercial).
Example: false

TransitTimeRecipient_address.description: Descriptive data on physical location. May be used as an actual physical address (place where one could go), or as a container of address parts, which should be handled as a unit (such as a city-state-ZIP combination within the US). Country code is required. Postal code is required for postal aware countries.

value.description:
Conditionally required.
Account number is required for ACCOUNT based rates. Account number value max length is 9.
Example: 60xxxxxx2

TransitTimeShippingChargesPayment_payor_.description: Specifies the FedEx customer account information of the responsible paty.
Conditional. The descriptive data for the payor of the shipment and their physical address, contact and account number information.

TransitTimeShippingChargesPayment_payor.description: Information about the person who is paying for the shipment.  Not applicable for credit card payment.

amount.description: Indicates the details of the charges are to be added.

currency.description:
Three-character ISO currency code.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency Codes

TransitTimeRequestedPackageLineItem_decl.description: This is the Declared Value - represents FedEx Maximum liability in connection with a shipment of that Package, including but not limited to, any loss, damage, delay, misdelivery, any failure to provide information, or misdelivery of information relating to the Shipment.

units.description:
Specify the unit of measurement used to weigh.
Example: LB

value.description:
Weight Value.
Example: 68.25
Click here to see Weight Values

TransitTimeRequestedPackageLineItem_weig.description: Weight of the packages or shipment

length.description:
Length of a package or shipment. Maximum Length is 999.
Example: 100

width.description:
Width dimensions of a package or shipment. Maximum Length is 999.
Example: 50

height.description:
Height of a package or shipment. Maximum Length is 999.
Example: 30

units.description:
Unit of measure for the provided dimensions.
Valid Values: IN - inches, CM - centimeters
Example: CM

TransitTimeRequestedPackageLineItem_dime.description: Specify the dimensions of this package and the unit type used for the measurements. Valid measurements are whole numbers greater than zero.

amount.description: Indicates the details of the charges are to be added to the COD collect amount.

currency.description:
Three-character ISO currency code.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency Codes

TransitTimeRequestedPackageLineItem_pack.description: Optional, but if indicated 'amount' and 'currency' must be provided.
Package COD Detail.  COD main information is set in shipment level.

units.description: Specify the unit of measurement used to weigh the dry ice used in packaging.

value.description:
Specify the value of weight of dry ice used in packaging.
Example: 10.0

TransitTimeRequestedPackageLineItem_pack.description: Specify weight of dry ice used in packaging.

accessibility.description: Dangerous Goods Accessibility Type. Inaccessible means it does not have to be accessable on the aircraft.  Accessible means it must be fully accessible on the aircraft, and is more strictly controlled.

options.description:
Optional

Specify the dangerous goods' detail from the list of available options.

TransitTimeRequestedPackageLineItem_pack.description: Use this object to specify Dangerous Goods shipment Detail.

alcoholRecipientType.description:
Specify the Alcohol Recipient Type of the shipment.
Example:
  • LICENSEE- FedEx approved alchol shipper having appropriate licenses.
  • CONSUMER- Individual consumer to whom the alchol is shipped.

shipperAgreementType.description:
Specify the shipper entity type.
Example: Fulfillment house, Retailer or a Winery.

TransitTimeRequestedPackageLineItem_pack.description: Provides information about the RecipientType and ShipperAgreementType. This object is manadatory if alcohol special service is selected.

batteryMaterialType.description: Describes the material composition of the battery or cell.

batteryPackingType.description: Describes the packing arrangement of the battery or cell with respect to other items within the same package.

batteryRegulatoryType.description: A regulation specific classification for the battery or cell.

TransitTimeRequestedPackageLineItem_pack.description: Describes attributes of a battery or cell that are used for classification purposes. Typically this structure would be used to allow customers to declare batteries or cells for which full dangerous goods documentation and procedures are not required.

specialServiceTypes.description:
Optional.
Specify special services requested for the package.
Example: ["DANGEROUS_GOODS"]
a onclick='loadDocReference("packagelevelspecialservicetypes")'>Click here to see Package Special Service Types

pieceCountVerificationBoxCount.description: Indicates the box count used for piece count verification.

TransitTimeRequestedPackageLineItem_pack.description:
Optional.
These special services are available at the package level for some or all service types. Indicated if rate data is being requested for the special services.

currency.description:
Indicate the three-character ISO currency code.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency Codes

TransitTimeCommodity_unitPrice.description: Indicate the amount details. This is optional, but if indicated, amount and currency must be provided.

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

AvailabilitycxsResponseVO.description: This is a wrapper class for outputVO

alerts.description: The cxs alert type, alert code, and alert message.

serviceOptionsList.description:
The list of options applicable when special service option is selected. The options include:
-Service types
-Signature options
-Package Special services list
-Return shipment list
-Carrier code
-Battery option list
-Alert list
-Shipment special services ist
-Cxs alerts

SpecialServicesOptionsOutputVO.description: The response elements for the special service availability request.

serviceType.description:
Indicates the type of service that is used to ship the package.
Example: INTERNATIONAL_FIRST
Click here to see Service Types

issEnabled.description: Specifies if international signature options are available.

signatureOptionsList.description: All possible signature options if signature options are available.  Indicated by the issEnabled boolean.

packageSpecialServicesList.description: Indicates the list of special services that are available at package level for some or all service types.

carrierCode.description:
Specify the four letter code of a FedEx operating company that meets your requirements
Examples of FedEx Operating Companies are:
  • FDXE - FedEx Express
  • FDXG - FedEx Ground
  • FXSP - FedEx SmartPost
  • FXCC - FedEx Custom Critical.

shipmentSpecialServicesList.description: Indicates the list of special services that are available at the shipment level for some or all service types.

OptionalServices.description: Holds the details of OptionalServices for the SpecialServiceOptions and PackageAndServiceOptions Endpoints

CodeDisplayTextVO.description: applicable key and display text value pairs.

subType.description: Specifies sub-type of the special service option.

specialServiceType.description:
Indicate the types of special services requested for the shipment.
Click here to see Package level Special Service Types

subType.description: Specifies sub-type of the special service option

value.description: Specifies the value of the special service option.

specialServiceType.description:
Specify special services requested for the package.
Example: BROKER_SELECT_OPTION
Click here to see Shipment Level Special Service Types.

ShipmentSpecialServiceOption.description:
FedEx Shipment Special Services options.
Click here to see Shipment Level Special Service Types

accountNumber.description: Account number associated with a Payor object. Example: Your account number

carrierCodes.description:
Optionally supplied to restrict the results to services for a specific carrier. Valid values are: FDXE, FDXG, FXSP.
Example: ["FDXG", "FDXE"]

Full_Schema_Special_Service_Options.description: The request elements for special service options availability.

shipper.description:
Required.
Indicate the Shipper contact details for this shipment.

recipient.description: Specifies the recipient details, such as postal code, state or province code, and country code of the recipient. Note: At least one recipient is required.

serviceType.description:
Indicate the FedEx service type used for the shipment. The result will be filtered by the serviceType value indicated.If a serviceType is not indicated, then all the applicable services and corresponding rates will be returned.
Example: STANDARD_OVERNIGHT
Click here to see Service Types

packagingType.description:
Specifies packaging Type.
Click here to see Package Types

shipDateStamp.description:
Conditional. Used to filter results to a specific ship date if populated on the request. Value will be defaulted to the current date/time.
Format: [YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD]
Example: 2020-10-13T11:00:00TZD
Note:
1.The date format must be YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD.
2.The time must be in the format: HH:MM:SS using a 24-hour clock.
3.The date and time are separated by the letter T, such as 2015-03-25T09:30:00.
4.The time is local to the pickup postal code.
5.Do not include a TZD (time zone designator) as it will be ignored.
Example: 2019-11-15T11:00:00

requestedPackageLineItems.description:
Conditional.
Specifies the packaging type, weight, and dimensions of the package. Applicable for EXPRESS and GROUND but not for FREIGHT shipments.

dropoffType.description:
Conditional
Required for Express and Ground, but optional for FREIGHT or SMARTPOST
Example: DROP_BOX

pickupType.description:
Indicate the pickup type method by which the shipment to be tendered to FedEx.
Note: The value of this element does not specify dispatching the courier for package pickup.
Click here for more information on Pickup Types.

RequestedShipment.description: shipment information for the shipment being requested

rateElementBasis.description:
Description of the percentage
Example: NET_CHARGE

freightDirectDataDetails.description: This field provides the list of data for Fedex Direct Detail service.There can be maximum of two allowed values for this field.

FreightDirectDetail.description: Specifies the freight Direct Detail.It is used for Fedex Freight Direct.

type.description:
This field provides the type for FedexFreight Detail service.
Example:
  • BASIC
  • BASIC_BY_APPOINTMENT
  • PREMIUM
  • STANDARD

transportationType.description:
This field provides the transportation type for Fedex Freight Detail service.
Example:
  • DELIVERY
  • PICKUP

eMailAddress.description: This field provides the email address associated with the freight user

phoneNumberDetails.description: This field prvides the phone number details associated with freight services

FreightDirectDataDetails.description: This field provides the data details for Fedex Freight Detail service.

phoneNumberType.description:
This provides the type of phoneNumber being used in request.
Example:
  • FAX
  • HOME
  • MOBILE
  • PAGER
  • TOLL_FREE
  • WORK

FreightPhoneNumberDetail.description: This field provides the phone Number details for the service.There can be maximum of five types of phoneNumber which can be provided in request.

message.description:
Indicates the description of API error alert message.
Example: The service is currently unavailable and we are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.

CXSError.description: Indicates error alert when suspicious files, potential exploits and viruses found while scanning files , directories and user accounts. This includes code, message and parameter

KeyDisplayTextVO.description: this object holds applicable key and display text value pairs.

units.description: Specify the unit of measurement used to weigh the shipment. The package and commodity weight unit should be the same else the request will result in an error.

value.description:
Specify the value of weight of shipment.
Example: 68.25

Weight.description:
Specify the total weight of the shipment.
This is only applies to International shipments and should be used on the first package of a multiple piece shipment. This value contains 1 explicit decimal position.

recipients.description: Specifies the recipient details, such as postal code, state or province code, and country code of the recipient. Note: At least one recipient is required.

shipDateStamp.description:
Required.
Specify the Shipment date. Required for future ship date. Default is current date if not indicated or date is in the past.
Format is YYYY-MM-DD.
Example: 2019-09-06

requestedPackageLineItems.description:
These are one or more package-attribute descriptions, each of which describes an individual package, a group of identical packages, or (for the total-piece-total-weight case) common characteristics of all packages in the shipment.
  • At least one instance containing the weight for at least one package is required for EXPRESS and GROUND shipments.
  • Not used for FREIGHT.
  • Single piece requests will have one RequestedPackageLineItem.
  • Multiple piece requests will have multiple RequestedPackageLineItems.
  • Maximum occurrences is 99.

pickupType.description:
Conditional Required for Express and Ground, but optional for FREIGHT or SMARTPOST.
Indicate the pickup type method by which the shipment yo be tendered to FedEx.
Note: The value of this element does not specify dispatching the courier for package pickup.
Click here for more information on Pickup Types.
Note:For services like FedEx International Connect Plus(FICP) & Regional Economy(RE)/Regional Economy Freight(REF) pickupType is mandatory.

value.description: This is the account number. Max Length is 9. Example: Your account number

AccountNumber.description: This is FedEx account number details.

length.description:
Indicate the length of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 20

width.description:
Indicate the width of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 10

height.description:
Indicate the height of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 10

units.description:
Indicate the Unit of measure for the provided dimensions.
Valid Values are:
  • IN - inches
  • CM - centimeters

    • Note: Any value other than CM including blank/null will default to IN.
    Example: CM

Dimensions.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

units.description:
The unit is in Cubic Feet or Cubic Meters.
Example: CUBIC_FT

Volume.description:
Optional

Individual line item volume.

Conditional

Need Volume or Rate for intra mexico rates

packageCount.description:
Indicates the total number of packages in the shipment that contain dry ice.
Example: 12

ShipmentDryIceDetail.description:
Number of packages in this shipment which contain dry ice.  The total weight of the dry ice for this shipment

 Both are required to indicate dry ice

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

emailAddress.description: Specify contact email address. Max length is 80.

phoneNumber.description: Specify contact person's phone number. Max length is 15.

phoneExtension.description: Specify contact person's phone extension. Max length is 6.

faxNumber.description: Specify contact person's fax number. Max length is 15.

Contact.description: Indicate the contact details for this shipment.

personName.description:
Specify the recipient contact person's name. Max Length is 70.
Example: John Taylor

emailAddress.description:
Contact person's email address. Max length is 80.
Example: sample@company.com

phoneNumber.description:
Contact person's phone number. Max length is 15.
Example: 1234567890

phoneExtension.description:
contact person's phone extension. Max length is 6.
Example: 91

faxNumber.description:
Contact person's fax number. Max length is 15.
Example: 956123

companyName.description:
Specify contact person's company name. Max length is 35.
Example: FedEx

Contact_2.description: Contact details for the Party such as Name, Email, PhoneNumber
